intro: Restio cephalotes, commonly known as the Cape reed or mountain reed, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in mountainous regions. The plant features slender, grass-like stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowering stems produce small, clustered inflorescences with tiny, white or pale green flowers. Restio cephalotes is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions, making it a resilient plant in its natural habitat.
